summary.long: Philemon is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God, always making mention of you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I hear about your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing that is in us for Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, although I have great confidence in Christ to order you to do what is proper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instead I appeal to you because of love, since I am such a one as Paul, now an old man and also a prisoner of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am appealing to you concerning my child whom I became the father of during my imprisonment, Onesimus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once he was useless to you, but now he is useful to you and to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I have sent back to you himself, that is, my heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I wanted to keep with me, in order that he might serve me on behalf of you during my imprisonment for the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But apart from your consent, I wanted to do nothing, in order that your good deed might be not as according to necessity, but according to your own free will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For perhaps because of this, he was separated from you for a time, in order that you might have him back forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if in anything he has caused you loss or owes you anything, charge this to my account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will pay it back, lest I mention to you that you owe me even your very self besides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, brother, I ought to have some benefit of you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you because I know that you will do even beyond what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
